com.cyc.kb

Interface Relation

  • All Superinterfaces:
    KbIndividual, KbObject, KbObject.KbObjectWithArity, KbTerm
    All Known Subinterfaces:
    BinaryPredicate, KbFunction, KbPredicate
    All Known Implementing Classes:
    BinaryPredicateWrapper, KbFunctionWrapper, KbPredicateWrapper, RelationWrapper

    public interface Relation
extends KbIndividual
    The common interface for KbPredicate and KbFunction. All Relations apply to one or more arguments to produce a new KbObject. Most of the methods in this interface describe restrictions on the number or types of arguments a Relation can apply to.

    • Nested Class Summary

      • Nested classes/interfaces inherited from interface com.cyc.kb.KbObject

      • getArgIsaList

        List<Collection<KbCollection>> getArgIsaList()
        Returns an ordered list of all argIsa constraints for this Relation. This method iterates over all the argument positions, that is, from 1 to getArity() and builds a list of argIsa constraints, as viewed from the default context DefaultContext.forQuery() set in SessionOptions.getDefaultContext().
        Returns:
        a list of argIsa constraints
        See Also:
        getArgGenl(int)

      • getArgIsaList

        List<Collection<KbCollection>> getArgIsaList(Context ctx)
        Returns an ordered list of all argIsa constraints for this Relation. This method iterates over all the argument positions, that is, from 1 to getArity() and builds a list of argIsa constraints, as viewed from Context ctx.
        Parameters:
        ctx - the context of query
        Returns:
        a list of argIsa constraints

      • getArgIsa

        Collection<KbCollection> getArgIsa(int argPos)
        gets the KbCollections that all arguments in position argPos of the relation most be instances of, as viewed from the default context DefaultContext.forQuery() set in SessionOptions.getDefaultContext(). The returned collection could be empty.

        Parameters:
        argPos - the relevant argument position of the relation
        Returns:
        the constraining getArgIsa KbCollections

      • getArgIsa

        Collection<KbCollection> getArgIsa(int argPos,
                                   Context ctx)
        gets the KbCollections that all arguments in position argPos of the relation most be instances of, as viewed from the context ctx.

        Parameters:
        argPos - the relevant argument position of the relation
        ctx - the context of the query
        Returns:
        the constraining getArgIsa KbCollections

      • addArgIsa

        Relation addArgIsa(int argPos,
                   KbCollection col,
                   Context ctx)
            throws KbTypeException,
                   CreateException
        creates a new Fact stating that any object in the argPos position of this relation should be an instance of the Collection col, in the context ctx.

        A formula satisfying these rules will be semantically well formed.

        Parameters:
        argPos - the argument position for the new argIsa constraint
        col - the collection for the new argIsa constraint
        ctx - the context where the constraint is to be stated
        Returns:
        this
        Throws:
        CreateException
        KbTypeException

      • getArgGenlList

        List<Collection<KbCollection>> getArgGenlList()
        Returns an ordered list of all argGenl constraints for this Relation. This method iterates over all the argument positions, that is, from 1 to getArity() and builds a list of argGenl constraints as viewed from DefaultContext.forQuery() set in SessionOptions.getDefaultContext().
        Returns:
        a list of argGenl constraints
        See Also:
        getArgGenl(int)

      • getArgGenlList

        List<Collection<KbCollection>> getArgGenlList(Context ctx)
        Returns an ordered list of all argGenl constraints for this Relation. This method iterates over all the argument positions, that is, from 1 to getArity() and builds a list of argGenl constraints, as viewed from Context ctx.
        Parameters:
        ctx - the context of query
        Returns:
        a list of argGenl constraints

      • getArgGenl

        Collection<KbCollection> getArgGenl(int argPos)
        gets the KbCollections that all arguments in position argPos of the relation must be specializations of, as viewed from the default context specified by DefaultContext.forQuery() set in SessionOptions.getDefaultContext().

        Parameters:
        argPos - the argument position of the relation
        Returns:
        the relevant argGenl constraints on this at position argPos

      • addArgGenl

        Relation addArgGenl(int argPos,
                    KbCollection col,
                    Context ctx)
             throws KbTypeException,
                    CreateException
        creates a new Fact stating that col must be a generalization of any object in the argPos position of this relation, in the context.

        A formula satisfying these rules will be semantically well formed.

        Parameters:
        argPos - the relevant argument position
        col - the collection which is a generalization of objects that fit in argPos
        ctx - the context where the fact is asserted
        Returns:
        this
        Throws:
        CreateException
        KbTypeException

      • getInterArgDifferent

        List<Integer> getInterArgDifferent(Context ctx)
        Returns a list of argument positions that should have explicitly different concepts for the truth/denotation condition to be valid. Some relations have interArgDifferent assertions defined on them. Return a single, arbitrary, interArgDifferent condition for the relation. If none is found, return null. Refer to comments on #$interArgDifferent in the KB for a more detailed discussion. Example: RelationFactory.get("largerThan").getInterArgDifferent(Constants.uvMt()); // == [1, 2]
        Parameters:
        ctx - the context of query for interArgDifferent assertion
        Returns:
        the list of arguments that need to be different

      • addInterArgDifferent

        Relation addInterArgDifferent(Integer argPosM,
                              Integer argPosN,
                              Context ctx)
                       throws KbTypeException,
                              CreateException
        Add a new interArgDifferent condition of this relation. The list of two argument positions that should have explicitly different concepts for the truth/denotation condition to be valid. Refer to comments on #$interArgDifferent in the KB for a more detailed discussion.
        Parameters:
        argPosM - one of the argument positions that needs to be different from the second
        argPosN - one of the argument positions that needs to be different from the first
        ctx - the context of assertion
        Returns:
        this object for method chaining
        Throws:
        KbTypeException
        CreateException

      • getArity

        Integer getArity()
          throws VariableArityException
        Return the number of arguments required for this relation. See getArityMin() and getArityMax() for arity information of variable arity relations.
        Specified by:
        getArity in interface KbObject.KbObjectWithArity
        Returns:
        the number of arguments required for this relation
        Throws:
        VariableArityException - for relations that have more than one possible arity value (i.e. for instances of #$VariableArityRelation).

      • isVariableArity

        boolean isVariableArity()
        Returns true if this is a variable-arity relation.
        Returns:
        whether or not this is a variable-arity relation.

      • getArityMin

        Integer getArityMin()
        find the minimum number of arguments required for the relation this. Note that except for the case of variable-arity relations, this method will return the same number as both getArity() and getArityMax().
        Returns:
        the minimum number of arguments allowed for this relation

      • getArityMax

        Integer getArityMax()
        find the maximum number of arguments required for the relation this. Note that except for the case of variable-arity relations, this method will return the same number as both getArity() and getArityMin().
        Returns:
        the maximum number of arguments allowed for this relation

      • setArity

        Relation setArity(int arityValue)
           throws KbTypeException,
                  CreateException
        Set the arity for a Cyc relation. If the relation has an arity value already that is different from arityValue, an exception will be thrown.
        Parameters:
        arityValue - the number of arguments this relation takes
        Returns:
        this
        Throws:
        CreateException
        KbTypeException

                   throws KbTypeException,

        Return a sentence to set the arity of a Cyc relation.
        Parameters:

        Returns:

        Throws:
